newsitem.title: HONG KONG: STAR TV in deal with Saudi Arabia's Orbit.
newsitem.headline: STAR TV in deal with Saudi Arabia's Orbit.

text.p: STAR TV (Middle East) Ltd has signed an agreement with Orbit Satellite Television & Radio Network under which STAR's new multi-channel package of services will be carried on the Orbit network in the Middle East, the companies said in a joint statement on Thursday.
The services are anticipated to become available by January 1997, the statement said.
"The deal reflects an important commitment by STAR to the Orbit platform," it said.
STAR channels, tailored specifically for the Middle East, will be receivable via the Orbit digital receiver, it said.
STAR TV and Orbit said they had scheduled a joint news conference in Dubai in October to provide specific information on the venture but gave no other details.
Hong Kong-based STAR Television is a unit of News Corp Ltd.
Orbit, which is wholly-owned by the Mawarid Group of Saudi Arabia, currently broadcasts a premium package of over 30 channels to 23 territories in the Middle East and North Africa.

Orbit in April cancelled its contract with the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) to transmit its Arabic service television to the Middle East in protest over a BBC programme which alleged human rights abuses in Saudi Arabia.
